description: Strand units: Representing and interpreting data

teaching.topicContent: Introduction to trend graphs and their use in representing trends over time. Discuss data sets such as height or weight in relation to age.
Review the concept of averages and their significance.
Extend the understanding of probability to calculate the likelihood of different outcomes.

test.description: Put your Data knowledge to the test.

questions.content: In a trend graph showing the population growth of a city over the past decade, the y axis represents the population, and the x axis represents the years. What does the horizontal axis represent?
You have a data set of ages: 12, 14, 11, 12, and 15. What is the mode of the ages?
A pie chart represents the distribution of favorite subjects among students. The 'Math' sector covers 36 degrees. What percentage of students chose Math as their favorite subject?
You have a data set of test scores: 85, 88, 90, 84, and 92. What is the mean (average) of the test scores?
A trend graph displays the change in the temperature of a city over a year. The y axis represents the temperature, and the x axis represents the months. What does the vertical axis represent?
If you flip two coins and roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of getting a tail on both coin flips and rolling an odd number?
You have a data set of shoe sizes: 5, 7, 6, 5, and 8. What is the median shoe size?
A trend graph shows the attendance at a sports event over a period of time. What information can be derived from the graph?
answers: The change in attendance over time

questions.content: If you roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of rolling a prime number?
You have a data set of the heights (in cm) of students: 140, 142, 138, 136, and 144. What is the range of the heights?

A trend graph displays the change in the stock price of a company over a month. The vertical axis represents the stock price, and the horizontal axis represents the days. What does the x axis represent?
If you roll two fair six-sided dice, what is the probability of getting a sum greater than 9?
You have a data set of test scores: 90, 88, 85, 90, and 84. What is the mode of the test scores?
In a pie chart representing the distribution of hobbies, the 'Sports' sector covers 63°. What percentage of students enjoy sports as a hobby?
You have a data set of the ages (in years) of students: 12, 13, 11, 14, and 12. What is the mean (average) age?
A trend graph shows the monthly rainfall in a city over a year. What information does the graph convey?
answers: Seasonal changes in the city's population
Number of sunny days in a month

questions.content: If you roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of rolling a number less than 5?
You have a data set of shoe sizes: 6, 9, 8, 7, and 9. What is the mode of the shoe sizes?
In a pie chart representing favorite colors, the 'Blue' sector covers 60°. What percentage of students chose blue as their favorite color?
A pie chart represents the distribution of ice cream flavors among students. The 'Chocolate' sector covers 45 degrees. What percentage of students chose Chocolate ice cream?
You have a data set of ages: 12, 14, 13, 12, and 15. What is the median of the ages?

In a trend graph showing the number of books read by a student each month, the vertical axis represents the number of books, and the horizontal axis represents the months. What does the x axis represent?
If you flip three coins and roll a fair number cube, how many equally likely outcomes are possible?
You have a data set of test scores: 82, 88, 85, 90, and 84. What is the mean (average) of the test scores?
If you roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of rolling an even number?
You have a data set of the heights (in cm) of students: 142, 134, 150, 138, and 144. What is the range of the heights?
In a pie chart representing favorite colors, the 'Blue' sector covers 36°. What percentage of students chose blue as their favorite color?
You have a data set of favorite fruits: Apple, Banana, Orange, Apple, and Banana. What is the mode of the data?

A trend graph displays the number of hours spent studying per week over 10 weeks. The vertical axis represents the hours studied, and the horizontal axis represents the weeks. What does the y axis represent?
If you flip two coins and roll a fair number cube, how many equally likely outcomes are possible?
A trend graph shows the growth of a plant's height over 6 months. What information can be derived from the graph?
answers: Number of leaves on the plant
Seasonal changes in the plant's color

questions.content: You have a data set of test scores: 85, 88, 90, 84, and 92. What is the median of the test scores?
In a pie chart representing the distribution of pets owned by students, the 'Cats' sector covers 108°. What percentage of students own cats?
You have a data set of the weights (in kg) of students: 38, 40, 42, 39, and 41. What is the mean (average) weight?
If you flip a coin and roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of landing on a head and an even number?
You have a data set of the heights (in cm) of students: 139, 122, 147, 170, and 110. What is the range of the heights?
In a pie chart representing favorite hobbies, the 'Reading' sector covers 72°. What percentage of students enjoy reading as a hobby?

In a trend graph showing the sales of a product over the last six months, the vertical axis represents the sales revenue, and the horizontal axis represents the months. What does the y axis represent?
You have a data set of test scores: 85, 90, 88, 92, and 84. What is the median test score?
A pie chart represents the distribution of favorite ice cream flavors among students. The 'Chocolate' sector covers 40%. What percentage of students did not choose chocolate as their favorite flavor?
You have a data set of ages: 12, 13, 12, 14, and 15. What is the mean (average) age?
A trend graph displays the change in the stock price of a company over a year. What information can be derived from the graph?
answers: The daily high and low prices
The fluctuation in stock price over time

questions.content: If you flip two coins and roll two fair number cube, what is the probability of getting at least one head on the coin flips and rolling an even number?
You have a data set of shoe sizes: 7, 8, 9, 8, and 7. What is the mode of the shoe sizes?
A trend graph shows the average temperature in a city over a year. What information does the graph convey?
answers: The highest temperature recorded in a year
The length of each day in a year

questions.content: If you roll a fair number cube, what is the probability of rolling a multiple of 3?
You have a data set of test scores: 92, 90, 84, 88, and 85. What is the median test score?
In a trend graph representing the attendance at a concert over a week, the vertical axis represents the attendance, and the horizontal axis represents the days. What does the x axis represent?
If you roll two fair number cubes, what is the probability of getting a sum less than 4?
A trend graph shows the number of books borrowed from a library over a year. What information does the graph convey?
answers: Trends in book borrowing over the year
The number of books available in the library
Average time spent reading each book
